instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
hi i have this macbook with 20v 0.24amp no power
i have voltage on coils around pm ic and all ssd voltage including g3s
i can boot the dfu mode and restore but i have error 9.
and notice that the device is not getting <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS</SIGNAL> voltage (not shorted)
i tried use thermalcam i can see slight overheating on a t2 chip.

history: previously water damage (other shop tried clean the corossion so i didnt see much
corossion.)

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS</SIGNAL>: 0V what does it mean? cpu or t2 having issue???

anyway i tried replaced pm ic because i saw some small lead on the coils around pm ic but nothing changes.

i have other same model is on dfu mode i test <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS</SIGNAL> got 3.3V (just to comparing/confirming if really have voltage <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS</SIGNAL> on dfu mode)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Did you compare diode mode readings to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS</SIGNAL> rail between both boards?
Also compare <CHIP>U8250</CHIP> voltages.

Be aware, board already touched in other service may be a nightmare.
